holidays.name: National Sticker Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the quirky, colorful, and sometimes hilarious world of stickers! From smiley faces on school notebooks to funky laptop decals, stickers are a fun form of self-expression.
holidays.origin: National Sticker Day originated in the United States to honor the invention of the pressure-sensitive sticker by R. Stanton Avery in 1935.
holidays.funFact: The world's most expensive sticker was a rare postage stamp sticker sold for millions at auction!

holidays.name: Make Your Dream Come True Day
holidays.description: An encouraging day to take the leap and chase your wildest dreams, no matter how big or bizarre they might seem.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday gained popularity through motivational circles and social media, inspiring people to act on their ambitions every January 13.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that people who write down their goals are 42% more likely to achieve them!

holidays.name: Rubber Duckie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the iconic bathtub buddy‚Äîthe rubber duckie! Known for its bright yellow color and cheerful squeak, this little toy has become a pop culture icon.
holidays.origin: Though no official founding date, rubber duckies became widely popular in the 1940s and 1950s and this day commemorates their joyous presence in bath time fun.
holidays.funFact: Rubber ducks are sometimes used in scientific research to study ocean currents when they are accidentally released into the sea during shipping mishaps!

holidays.name: Kiss a Ginger Day
holidays.description: A playful and affectionate day encouraging people to show love and appreciation to redheads, who are often underrepresented in pop culture and folklore.
holidays.origin: This lighthearted unofficial day emerged from internet memes and social media communities celebrating red-haired individuals.
holidays.funFact: Red hair is caused by a mutation in the MC1R gene, which is recessive‚Äîmaking natural redheads only about 1-2% of the world population!
